Over the next 10 years Bitcoin block rewards will be cut by ~90% and if Bitcoin is going to stay secure it *needs* a large fee market.

I agree with 
@lopp
 that the best way to do so would be to target a USD value of tx fees per block. Interested to see ideas on implementation...
Jameson Lopp
@lopp
 · Feb 11, 2019
Replying to @VinnyLingham and @LukeDashjr
No no no, you're all wrong. The block weight should not be reduced to an arbitrary number, but rather it should adjust dynamically to target $100 transaction fees to pay for thermodynamic security and force spammy use cases onto Lightning Network. Fee market or bust!
